definition[0]: to hang down or bend in the middle, especially because of the weight of something
example[0]: The branch sagged under the weight of the apples.
example[1]: The skin around my eyes is starting to sag.
definition[1]: to become weaker or less valuable
example[3]: attempts to revive the sagging economy
definition[2]: (Screen Actors' Guild) a trade union in the US for actors and actresses who perform in films for the cinema or television
definition[3]: to become weaker or to fall in amount
example[4]: The airline industry tends to sag during recessions.
